answers.answer: Initial answer to your question is yes, a dental infection can very easily go systemic if left untreated.  It can even become life threatening.The tingling/numbness sounds like an uncontrolled diabetic problem.  One of the long term effects of diabetes is decreased circulation, which you would notice as tingling/numbness.I would suggest finding a dental school that can take care of the infected teeth at a very discounted rate, or check with your state and local dental societies to see if they offer any charity work.
